Specific Details: Brexit: Priorities of Irish business re EU Competition Policy and Brexit
Subject Matter: Brexit: Priorities of Irish business re EU Competition Policy and Brexit
Intended Results: To ensure that policy-makers, political parties and government are fully aware of the economic risks associated with Brexit and the likely impact that different scenarios have for individual companies.::To ensure the Government and State agencies take proactive steps domestically to offset these risks.::To ensure Government adopts a position in negotiations that seeks to minimise economic disruption and adverse effects on Irish companies.

To ensure that policy-makers, political parties and government (local and national) are fully aware of the economic risks associated with Brexit and the likely impact that different scenarios have for individual companies.::To ensure the Government, State agencies and local government take proactive steps domestically to offset these risks.::To ensure Government adopts a position in negotiations that seeks to minimise economic disruption and adverse effects on Irish companies.

Specific Details: Campaign to advance the future of Irish trade in services

Specific Details: On behalf of the owners of Limerick One Shopping Park, Childers Road, Limerick, our organisation contacted councillors in Limerick City & County Council requesting the proposed rezoning of the Park is rejected as the current zoning allows the Park to trade successfully, provide an attractive and diverse retail offer to the local community. The proposed rezoning disadvantages the businesses that trade in the Park and the residents/local community who shop and work at the Park.
DPOs Lobbied: Sarah Kiely|Councillor|Limerick City and County Council::Michael Murphy|Councillor|Limerick City and County Council::Michael Sheahan|Councillor|Limerick City and County Council
Subject Matter: On behalf of the owners of Limerick One Shopping Park, Childers Road, Limerick, our organisation contacted councillors in Limerick City & County Council requesting the proposed rezoning of the Park is rejected as the current zoning allows the Park to trade successfully, provide an attractive and diverse retail offer to the local community. The proposed rezoning disadvantages the businesses that trade in the Park and the residents/local community who shop and work at the Park.
Intended Results: The rejection of the proposed rezoning of Limerick One Shopping Park. We have invited the opportunity to discuss the matter further.
Lobbying Activities:
Email was sent to Councillor Sarah Kiely on Monday 6th December. The email contained a letter (attachment) concerning the proposed rezoning of Limerick One Shopping Park. The content of the letter detailed the concerns held regarding the consequences of the proposed rezoning of Limerick One Shopping Park.
The email invited the opportunity to meet further to discuss any questions the councillor may have.
The email was sent by Neil Bannon (Bannon) and cc'd George Colyer (Bannon)|Email|1::Email was sent to Councillor Michael Murphy on Monday 6th December. The email contained a letter (attachment) concerning the proposed rezoning of Limerick One Shopping Park. The content of the letter detailed the concerns held regarding the consequences of the proposed rezoning of Limerick One Shopping Park.
The email invited the opportunity to meet further to discuss any questions the councillor may have.
The email was sent by Neil Bannon (Bannon) and cc'd George Colyer (Bannon)|Email|1::Email was sent to Councillor Michael Sheahan on Monday 6th December. The email contained a letter (attachment) concerning the proposed rezoning of Limerick One Shopping Park. The content of the letter detailed the concerns held regarding the consequences of the proposed rezoning of Limerick One Shopping Park.
The email invited the opportunity to meet further to discuss any questions the councillor may have.
The email was sent by Neil Bannon (Bannon) and cc'd George Colyer (Bannon)|Email|1
Client(s): IRISH LIFE ASSURANCE PUBLIC LIMITED COMPANY|IRISH LIFE CENTRE LOWER ABBEY STREET DUBLIN 1. DUBLIN 1, DUBLIN|nbannon@bannon.ie|+353 (1) 6477900

Specific Details: Ref. the Local Area Plan Development for Clonmel 2024-2030. This plan sets out a land use strategy and investment objectives for the town and its environs.
DPOs Lobbied: Pat English|Councillor|Tipperary County Council::Richie Molloy|Councillor|Tipperary County Council::John Fitzgerald|Councillor|Tipperary County Council::Niall Dennehy|Councillor|Tipperary County Council::Michael Murphy|Councillor|Tipperary County Council::Andy Maloney|Councillor|Tipperary County Council
Subject Matter: Ref. the Local Area Plan Development for Clonmel 2024-2030. This plan sets out a land use strategy and investment objectives for the town and its environs.
Intended Results: To amend the rezoning on Burgagery West, Powerstown Centre, Inner Relief Road, Clonmel and to retain the existing rezoning on Burgagery East Lands, Davis Road, Clonmel.
